result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven S Buchli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: any vehicle titled or registered in defendant's name is subject to IID installation.

miscConds.notes: No bars, liquor stores, beer tents or taverns.

DNA sample. 

Jail/probation may be transferred to county of residence; Wood County.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; no objection to EMP.  Defendant must report within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven S Buchli

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Marathon County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called: 11:13 a.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
State appears by ADA Alex Lech; Defendant appears w/Atty Eric Sheets;

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made a factual basis & defendant guilty;

PLEA:
CT 1 (OWI (4th))>>NO CONTEST.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence withheld for 2 years of probation: CONDITIONS: 90 days MCJ (must report within 60 days) with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 27 months. 27 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed). No bars/liquor store/beer tents/taverns.  $600.00 fine plus CC and DNA surcharge; DNA sample. 2 days credit. 

Jail and probation may be transferred to county of residence - Wood County. 

Adjourned: 11:30 a.m.
Plea hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Calendar call on June 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
ADA Lech appears; Atty Sheets appears via phone; Parties have an agreement; Plea hearing set;

records.addlTxt: Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Report to Attic Correctional Services within 1 business day at Level 1 (715-848-3202).

Case Called: 9:26 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Defendant has obtained Atty Sheets, but Atty Sheets was unable to appear for today's hearing.
Defendant states that he will proceed without Atty Sheets for today.
Complaint Filed. Complaint Read. Advised of Right to Counsel. Time Limits Waived.

PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS:
$1,000 Signature Bond.

CONDITIONS:
-Prints and Photos
-Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol
-No Bars/Liquor Stores/Taverns
-No Driving without Valid License
-Report to ATTIC within 1 Business Day @ Level 1

CC 03/15/2022 @ 1:00 pm - Schedule Prelim with Atty Sheets
